data.title: Added Visual Studio 2015 support along with templates for projectGene…
data.body: with templates for projectGenrator (Project Manager)

data.title: Tweening for GUI
data.body:
[Twillex](https://gist.github.com/blackwc/068b40609d9e33e244b4) for Torque 2D can be used with Torque 3D.

I've made some changes so that diagonal tweens work. It should be integrated into a template.

data.title: adds an "altfreelook" cam mode for players
data.body:
This adds a new camera mode in third person for the player. It's meant for when the player has no weapon (or the weapon is holstered). The camera sticks to the back of the player's head when moving otherwise it can freely rotate around the player.

Thanks to "newaged" from the IRC for figuring out a rotation issue.

It works in script similar to how freelook works. If "$mvAltFreeLook" is true then the altfreelook camera mode is used for third person. This can be turned off at any time by setting "$mvAltFreeLook" to false.

data.title: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8461832/explicit-qualification-in-…
data.body: …declaration

data.title: vsprintf replacement with engine vairant
data.body:
resolves first issue in
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/1515#issuecomment-184446719

data.title: ‘vsprintf’ was not declared in this scope
data.body:
Merged latest development: /Engine/source/core/stream/stream.cpp:131:52: error: ‘vsprintf’ was not declared in this scope
    const S32 length = vsprintf(buffer, format, args);

data.title: Graphics Corruption/Crash [Linux]
data.body:
Main menu loads offset to the top-right and mouse input is also offset: http://img.ctrlv.in/img/16/02/14/56c0f55f311e0.png  Maximizing the window then restoring, fixes the offsetting.

Resizing the window arbitrarily, causes graphics corruption and sometimes crashes: http://img.ctrlv.in/img/16/02/14/56c0f57ac5c77.png

Arbitrarily the game loads with graphics corruption: http://img.ctrlv.in/img/16/02/14/56c0f59a395ad.png

Resizing in-game causes a crash in fglrx_dri.so.  Gdb showed an empty backtrace.

Edit: got this too: /Engine/source/gfx/gl/gfxGLTextureTarget.cpp(203,0): {Fatal} - Something really bad happened with an FBO

Edit: glitches/crashes less often with advanced lighting off.

data.title: Win32 fullscreen fix partial
data.body:
A lot of resolutions look like this in fullscreen mode. http://i.imgur.com/DZozand.png
This fixes a few of them.

data.title: [OpenGL - Win32] This fix a bug during resolution change.
data.body:
This part I changed was the OpenGL fullscreen support I wrote 1 year ago to help Luis during his efforts.
I formatted the code following the T3D convention, removed legacy headers and I fixed this problem:

If you have Torque3D configured on Windows using OpenGL renderer.
Try this:
-go to main menu.
-set fullscreen checkbox to on. Doesn't matter for resolution you are using.
-set a lower resolution, don't turn back on windowed mode yet.
-return to windowed mode disabling fullscreen checkbox.

You'll return to windowed mode, however the desktop resolution won't be restored as the original.

data.title: Point2/4 constructor Initialize all elements to the same value
data.body: Just fixed up Point2/4 so you can initialize all elements to the same value like in mPoint3I/F/D

data.title: Fix fox SFXPlaylist breaking networking
data.body:
SFXPlaylist tries to write too many bits into the bitstream, which seems
to be responsible for a few issues people have had with non-local
servers. This might not be the best way to go about fixing it, but its
not as bad as what is in the engine right now.

data.title: Fix for callOnChildren crashing
data.body:
callOnChildren crashed my game every time I attempted to use it, so I
tried to fix it. It now works most of the time, but it will still crash the
engine if a method it calls deletes the Simset it is working on.

data.title: Fix for collision issues with scaled players
data.body:
Players scaled after their creation have collision issues with terrain.
Changing this bit of code fixes those issues for downsized players, even
when shrunk to 10% of their original size.

data.title: ResourceLeakFix for OpenGL
data.body:
This resolves some errors related on render targets and other resources which they are never released after creation causing memory leak. It is specific OpenGL fix inside OpenGL render api implementation.
Thank you (:

If you open the netGraph and then later look into console.log you will see console spam related to netGraph like:

core/art/gui/netGraphGui.gui (214): Unable to find object: 'ServerConnection' attempting to call function 'getPacketLoss'

data.title: Glow buffer graphic corruption fix on OpenGL.
data.body:
Caused by a wrong target size. (probably it was ok on the very old OpenGL 1.5 version)
Before fix, wrong behaviour:
http://goo.gl/dik7Ia
After fix, all right:
http://goo.gl/IsrckM

data.title: dragCoefficient misspelt 6 times over 2 scripts
data.body:
dragCoeffiecient??? One "e" too many. Should be "dragCoefficient"

Offending entries:
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Templates/Full/game/art/datablocks/weapons/rocketfx.cs#L31
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Templates/Full/game/art/datablocks/weapons/rocketfx.cs#L31
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Templates/Full/game/art/datablocks/weapons/grenadefx.cs#L301
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Templates/Full/game/art/datablocks/weapons/grenadefx.cs#L465
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Templates/Full/game/art/datablocks/weapons/grenadefx.cs#L633
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Templates/Full/game/art/datablocks/weapons/grenadefx.cs#L848

Happens 6 times but only 1 has a setting that is not zero. Not handy if you're gonna copy and paste example scripts though. ;)

data.title: PostFXManager and PostFX Scripts updates with better naming consistency
data.body:
I have changed some PostFX variable for better consistency:
-$VignettePostEffect changed to $VignettePostFX - So it fit with others
-$PostFXManager::Settings::EnabledSSAO changed to $PostFXManager::Settings::EnableSSAO - Like other PostFX
-I have change all LightRay reference to be singular like the PostFX (LightRays to LightRay)

Added some fields that were missing:
targetScale for SSAO
exposure, resolutionScale for LightRay 
VMin for Vignette

Added the ChromaticLens (CA) PostFX to GUI
Fields: distCoeffecient colorDistortionFactor cubeDistortionFactor

PostFxManagerGui updates:
-Hidded the quality options which seem to be no longer supported
-Change the Vignette Page to Misc to hold PostFX with few setttings. I added a Rollout system in that page to be able to add more PostFX later.
-Added a Color Ramp image preview for the selected image.

Added a missing Profile for Rollout, in case user want to call the Gui with no tools. The GuiRolloutProfile is set in editor so I created a GuiRolloutCoreProfile for in-game use.

This is my first pull request and I hope it's correct. I could have update the PostFXManager more to look better and would do on request.

data.title: Decal Fade Does Not Work
data.body:
Whilst hunting around decals I noticed that the fade does not work. Try setting fadeTime higher, lower, or equal makes no difference.

Here's what it says the variable should do.
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/master/Engine/source/T3D/decal/decalData.cpp#L153-L156

And here's the only place it gets used:
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/master/Engine/source/T3D/decal/decalManager.cpp#L1093

data.title: Decal Properties Wrongly Name In Script
data.body:
LOD for decals can be generated but the properties are wrongly named in the script file.

https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/master/Templates/Full/game/art/decals/managedDecalData.cs#L42-L43
and
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/master/Templates/Full/game/art/decals/managedDecalData.cs#L54-L55

Decals with properties are not referenced in the source:
   screenStartRadius
   screenEndRadius

Those  should be the properties referenced in the source which are:
   fadeStartPixelSize
   fadeEndPixelSize

https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/master/Engine/source/T3D/decal/decalData.cpp#L89-L90

My apologies for not putting in a pull request, I'm too autistic to be a normie but not autistic enough to use github without pulling my hair out ;)

data.title: footstep and impact enum extension support
data.body:
Removes hardcoded case statements in favor of an offset-driven approach.

While the enums were kept for this for backwards compatibility, I'd strongly advise 4.0 shifts to a more script-driven vector+key approach vs the vector+enum+hardcoded script exposed names.

data.title: Fix case sensitivity and Platform::fileDelete
data.body: for linux and OSX. Correct a couple of warnings and errors preventing builds on linux.

data.title: Use Tri-Planar Texture Mapping for Better Terrain
data.body:
Same title as described here and some code reference:

http://gamedevelopment.tutsplus.com/articles/use-tri-planar-texture-mapping-for-better-terrain--gamedev-13821

It should make those cliffs or vertical regions of the terrain more appealing than stretched out in its current state when you apply terrain textures.

data.title: vecLib deprecated, Mac platform should use Acclerate/Accelerate.h
data.body: And in general, we almost certainly shouldn't be doing anything altivec anymore, unless someone is planning to support PPC Unix/Linux platforms.

data.title: U32 for id-type in ThreadManager is horribly unsafe
data.body: In particular, platforms which support 64-bit pthreads will be returning a >32-bit pointer for the ID. Truncation is not an option as this is elsewhere cast back into a pointer.

data.title: AiPlayer run animation fix
data.body:
While trying out AI players, I noticed a weird sliding motion without any run or side animation most of the time. After doing some tests, I still find this solution to be working when applied.

Reference:
http://www.garagegames.com/community/resource/view/11218/
